content: On November 20, 1991, the Atlanta Braves made a significant move by acquiring second baseman Jeff Blauser from the Chicago Cubs in a trade. Blauser would go on to become a key player for the Braves during their successful run in the 1990s, contributing to the team's success as they won the National League pennant in 1991 and the World Series in 1995. His defensive skills and ability to get on base made him an integral part of the Braves' lineup during this era.
